page.title: 09GOXHILL MEMORIAL HALL.
page.content: The Memorial Hall was built by public subscription as a memorial to those men of the village who lost their lives in the First World War. It was opened by Sir Berkley Sheffield on 7th March, 1925. Set in the front of the hall are plaques bearing the names of those who died in both the First and Second World Wars. At first the Memorial Hall was run by a committee, then by the Parish Council who returned the running of the building to a committee over twelve years ago. The Hall is a registered charity which is self financing. So great is the Hall's use that it was necessary to extend the width of the Hall by the addition of wings at each side. Set in its own grounds the Memorial Hall has its own tennis court which was recently resurfaced.
